## Vocabulary 

| Term | Definition |
|:---|:---|
| iterate | Repeat a process with improvements and a certain time-box |
| sprint | Short, time-boxed iterations in Scrum, usually 2-4 weeks |
| sprint goal | A clear objective for the sprint to achieve |
| sprint backlog | A prioritized list of items to be worked on during the sprint |
| planning poker | A consensus-based estimation technique used in Scrum with this serie to weight tasks: 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21 |
| scrum master | A facilitator who ensures the team adheres to Scrum principles, link to company |
| product owner | A person responsible for the product backlog and its priorities, link to client |
| principles | Transparency, Inspection, Adaptation, and Delivery |
| beyond scrum | Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), LeSS, Nexus |
| agile | A methodology for software development that values flexibility and collaboration |
| user story | A description of a feature or requirement from the perspective of the end-user |
